metadata.description: This archive contains outputs from 01-May initialized hindcasts performed with the latest developmental version of ECMWF's seasonal forecasting suite. The configuration closely matches that used for ECMWF's operational SEAS5 seasonal forecasts (Johnson et al.,2018), but uses the latest cycle (cy46r1) of the ECMWF IFS coupled model. The outputs have been regridded from its native resolution (Tco319, ~32 km) to a regular 1x1 degree grid.

background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.

We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的主要挑战之一。最近的研究表明，春季青藏 Plateau（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S可预测性的一个新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一大挑战，预测失败可能对社会和经济造成重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，例如与马登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了可预测性来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了一个新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

中纬度的背景温度梯度也影响了斜压涡旋的活动（Xue et al., 2023），这进一步加强了纬向风的变化，并在涡旋向下游移动并与纬向流相互作用时进一步影响下游的纬向风。青藏高原下游的纬向风响应与这些研究一致，表现为北太平洋喷流核心沿线的纬向风显著减速。同时，在喷流核心北侧发现纬向风显著加速，表明喷流略微向北偏移。这种纬向风的变化在观测中也有对应（见图4b）。图5a中的一个显著特征是青藏高原上方200 hPa的强负位势高度异常，伴随着气旋异常环流。这种环流响应对应于青藏高原上的冷异常，导致大气下沉并在上层产生负位势高度异常。此外，从青藏高原向北太平洋下游明显显示出波状模式的位势高度差（见图5a）。青藏高原上方的负位势高度异常中心向东延伸至日本，而在白令海峡东侧出现一个强正位势高度中心，伴随反气旋环流，中心位于约170°E，50°N。波状的位势高度差进一步从落基山脉延伸穿过北美大陆、北大西洋，回到欧亚大陆。上述模拟的气候环流响应总体上与2003年5月的观测位势高度异常一致（见图5b）。此外，在南半球，尤其是在中纬度地区，也注意到对青藏高原冷表面的位势高度响应（见图5a, b）。因此，我们还检查了模拟风场的异常流函数。波动能量通量（WAF）与罗斯贝波的群速度平行，可以大致指示波能量的传播。

尽管由于海洋温度异常引起的热带遥相关（teleconnections），例如ENSO与亚洲季风之间的关系，已经得到了广泛研究（例如，Wang等，2000；Li等，2007；Li等，2017），但山地加热对全球大气环流的远程影响尚未得到充分研究。LS4P-I实验提供了一个机会，以探索TRC波列的详细特征以及大气环流对青藏高原表面异常的全球响应。众所周知，青藏高原的热状态可以显著影响东亚的天气和气候（例如，Liu等，2020）。早期研究表明，在夏季，北半球的副热带地区沿着西风急流存在一个环全球遥相关模式（CTP）。强对流季风降水的潜热被认为是CTP的主要驱动因素（例如，Lau和Peng，1991；Lau和Weng，2002；Lau等，2004；Ding和Wang，2005；Ding等，2011）。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化陆面温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季陆面温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的16个当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区陆面降温的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探讨TP的作用及热带环流（TRC）波列在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列如何影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。
我们的目标是将热带低频（TP LST/SUBT）对全球大气环流的影响与热带环流波列（TRC wave train）的动态特征相结合，重点关注其在改善季节到季节（S2S）预测中的重要性。
challengesCn: 然而，从热带地区向南半球的模拟传播路径显示出较大的模型间差异。
然而，模拟的波列与观测之间存在相位差异。然而，从北大西洋到乌拉尔山脉的区域，观测到的地势高度异常与多模型平均值显示出相反的符号，这表明在这些区域，地表冷却可能不是观测到的环流异常的主要原因。主要区别在于，模型集合中模拟的气候响应演变速度快于观测。南半球环流中模型响应的相关多样性可能是模拟响应与观测之间存在巨大不一致的主要原因之一，尽管模型集合在南半球中高纬度地区显示出强烈的响应。

与观测相比，LS4P-I 的气候模型（ESMs）在 2003 年 5 月未能很好地捕捉到观测到的 T2m 冷异常。16 个 LS4P-I ESMs 的集合均值在青藏 Plateau（TP）上表现出 1.02 °C 的暖偏差，这一偏差强于 TP T2m 的观测年际变化标准差（约 0.7 °C）。模型集合均值的偏差空间分布如图 1b 所示，显示出 2003 年 5 月 TP 东部地区 T2m 的明显暖偏差。LS4P-I 模拟进一步表明，TP 表面的热状态不仅对北半球具有全球影响，还影响南半球的外热带大气环流，尽管由于模型间的变异性，这一影响存在较大不确定性。
methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与5月TP表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP气温上的偏差。
datasetCn: 模拟的200 hPa位势高度差的集合均值在图5a中展示，同时与2003年5月的观测结果（图5b）一起，进一步探讨了大气环流对青藏 Plateau（TP）地表温度/土壤湿度效应的响应。

在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）的观测气温（T2m）异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气再分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的常规水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。所有数据均以0.5° × 0.5°的空间分辨率提供。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02（Harris等，2014；2020）。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的表面温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC）从青藏高原调制，经过东北亚和白令海峡到达北美西部，并影响整个北太平洋盆地的春季西风急流。由青藏高原热异常调制的TRC波列在早夏的表面气温和降水异常中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美西北部和南部大平原地区。这些结果表明，青藏高原的地表温度/土壤温度异常通过TRC波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。

这些结果综合表明，青藏 Plateau（TP）的表面和地下温度对热点地区的影响中，TRC波列起着关键作用，尤其是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列影响这些不同地区降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。集合模型模拟显示，在亚太地区的强西风急流下，TP表面降温会产生一个从TP通过东北亚和白令海峡延伸到北美西部的条带性、持久性（演变时间尺度超过一个月）的TRC波列，其特征与2003年5月至6月观察到的地势高度异常非常相似。

Xue et al. (2022) 讨论了TP LST/SUBT效应对6月降水的模拟集合均值的关键特征。然而，LS4P-I实验表明，TP表面异常可以导致大气环流的持续和全球尺度异常，并对S2S时间尺度上的夏季2米气温和降水产生近全球影响。此外，LS4P-I实验确认并强调了TRC波列在TP表面异常全球影响中的重要甚至关键作用。对16个先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）的分析首次表明，春季TP表面异常可以调节持久的准气旋TRC波列。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱/洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏 Plateau（TP）春季观测到的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水之间存在滞后相关性，但当前全球陆气耦合模型由于在产生观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在气候系统中不同尺度的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探索它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态众所周知在调节地球气候方面发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常之间的联系，如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜，已被用于预测气候事件，并在几个月到几年范围内具有有用的技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原（TP）的春季地面温度可能影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种陆地表面变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，特别是在S2S预测中的应用仍然被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一项社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度相当。LS4P的目标是检验2003年5月观察到的青藏高原冷异常是否导致全球热点地区6月降水异常的出现。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，往往集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，原因在于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这一缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在澳大利亚西部和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是由于其他涉及的过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录被用来检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用了16个最先进的LS4P ESM（表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行了第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的LST/SUBT初始条件，其他初始和边界条件以及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏高原的80个站点以及中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。来自观测和多种地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区地面温度的模拟，从而使ESM更好地预测6月在热点地区的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能通过升高的加热成为S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.

datasetCn: 在图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）的观测气温（T2m）异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的规则水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列，从青藏 Plateau 通过东北亚和白令海峡传递到北美西部，并与春季的西风急流相互作用。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。此外，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度异常还可以通过产生跨赤道波列影响南半球的环流。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'initialized land surface temperature and snowpack' in the context of subseasonal to seasonal prediction studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在次季节到季节预测研究中，“初始化的地表温度和积雪”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: Initialized land surface temperature and snowpack refer to setting initial conditions of land surface and snowpack data in climate models to improve the accuracy of subseasonal to seasonal predictions. This involves using observed data to initialize models, which can help in capturing the influence of land and snowpack temperatures on atmospheric conditions and precipitation patterns.
Definition.AnswerCn: 初始化的地表温度和雪盖指的是在气候模型中设置地表和雪盖数据的初始条件，以提高亚季节到季节预测的准确性。这涉及使用观测数据来初始化模型，这有助于捕捉地面和雪盖温度对大气条件和降水模式的影响。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions influence the predictability of subseasonal-to-seasonal climate phenomena in mountainous regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 土地表面温度和雪盖条件的初始化如何影响山区亚季节到季节气候现象的可预测性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions can enhance predictability by improving the accuracy of model simulations. This is particularly relevant for the Tibetan Plateau, where springtime temperature anomalies can modulate atmospheric wave trains that impact global precipitation patterns. Such initialization helps models better capture the observed anomalies and predict downstream climate events, especially in remote regions sensitive to temperature variations.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 土地表面温度和雪盖条件的初始化可以通过提高模型模拟的准确性来增强可预测性。这在青藏高原尤为相关，因为春季温度异常可以调节影响全球降水模式的大气波列。这种初始化有助于模型更好地捕捉观察到的异常并预测下游气候事件，特别是在对温度变化敏感的偏远地区。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the potential implications of using reanalysis data like ERA5 in interpreting atmospheric circulation patterns and climatic responses?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用重分析数据如ERA5来解释大气环流模式和气候响应的潜在影响是什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Reanalysis data like ERA5 provide a consistent and comprehensive record of atmospheric conditions, which is crucial for interpreting circulation patterns and climatic responses. This data allows researchers to compare model simulations against observed conditions, assess the influence of land surface temperature anomalies on global circulation, and improve the understanding of mechanisms driving climate variability. However, the accuracy of these interpretations depends on the quality and resolution of the reanalysis data, which may vary across regions and time periods.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 再分析数据如ERA5提供了一致且全面的大气条件记录，这对于解释环流模式和气候响应至关重要。这些数据使研究人员能够将模型模拟与观测条件进行比较，评估地表温度异常对全球环流的影响，并改善对气候变异驱动机制的理解。然而，这些解释的准确性取决于再分析数据的质量和分辨率，而这些在不同地区和时间段可能会有所不同。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in preserving the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies in current Earth System Models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在当前的地球系统模型中，影响初始化地表温度异常记忆保存的挑战因素包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature (LST) anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data, which provide unbalanced initial atmospheric and land conditions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度（LST）异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和再分析数据中的缺陷，这些缺陷导致大气和陆地初始条件的不平衡。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the large inter-model differences in the simulated propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致从青藏高原到南半球的模拟传播路径存在较大模型间差异的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The large inter-model differences in the simulated propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere are due to variations in how different models capture the Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train and its propagation, leading to inconsistencies in predicting climate anomalies compared to observations and successful models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 不同气候模型在模拟从青藏高原传播到南半球的路径时存在较大差异，这主要是由于不同模型在捕捉青藏高原-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC）及其传播方式上的差异，导致在预测气候异常时与观测结果和成功模型之间存在不一致。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the overarching goal of utilizing initialized land surface temperature and snowpack data in subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 利用初始化的地表温度和雪盖数据在季节内到季节间预测模型中的总体目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The overarching goal is to study the impact of springtime land surface temperature and subsurface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions, with an aim to improve the prediction skill at subseasonal-to-seasonal timescales by identifying new sources of predictability, such as those provided by the Tibetan Plateau anomalies.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 总体目标是研究春季地表温度和高山地区地下温度异常对夏季降水预测的影响，旨在通过识别新的可预测性来源（例如由青藏 Plateau 异常提供的可预测性）来提高亚季节到季节时间尺度的预测技能。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are typically followed to initialize land surface temperature and snowpack conditions for subseasonal to seasonal prediction models?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 通常在亚季节到季节预测模型中，初始化地表温度和雪盖条件的程序包括哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In the LS4P project, an innovative approach was used to initialize land surface temperature and subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau. This was done by adjusting the initial conditions based on each model's T2m bias and observed anomalies over the Tibetan Plateau. The initialization process is critical to enhancing the model's ability to simulate springtime anomalies and improve the predictability of June precipitation over identified hotspots.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在LS4P项目中，采用了一种创新的方法来初始化青藏高原的地表温度和地下温度（LST/SUBT）。这一过程是通过根据每个模型的2米温度偏差和青藏高原的观测异常来调整初始条件。初始化过程对于增强模型模拟春季异常的能力和提高对识别热点地区6月降水的可预测性至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can observational data be integrated into climate models to improve prediction accuracy for subseasonal to seasonal timescales?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何将观测数据整合到气候模型中，以提高亚季节到季节时间尺度的预测准确性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Observational data such as T2m records from the Chinese Meteorological Administration and the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System were used to evaluate and adjust the performance of Earth System Models (ESMs) in producing observed anomalies. By integrating these records, models can be calibrated to better simulate the observed thermal state of the Tibetan Plateau, which is crucial for accurately predicting downstream climate impacts during the summer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 观测数据，如中国气象局的T2m记录和气候异常监测系统的数据，被用来评估和调整地球系统模型（ESMs）在产生观测异常方面的表现。通过整合这些记录，可以对模型进行校准，以更好地模拟青藏高原的观测热状态，这对于准确预测夏季下游气候影响至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the typical challenges faced in using reanalysis data for initializing climate models, and how might these be addressed?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在使用再分析数据初始化气候模型时，通常面临哪些挑战，以及如何解决这些挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: One of the challenges with using reanalysis data for initializing climate models is that they may provide unbalanced initial atmospheric and land conditions due to deficiencies in model parameterizations. This can lead to an inability to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies. Addressing these challenges involves improving model parameterizations and using observational data to better initialize and balance these conditions, thus enhancing predictive skill for subseasonal to seasonal forecasts.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 使用再分析数据初始化气候模型的一个挑战是，由于模型参数化的缺陷，它们可能提供不平衡的初始大气和陆地条件。这可能导致无法充分保留初始化的地表温度异常的记忆。解决这些挑战需要改进模型参数化，并利用观测数据更好地初始化和平衡这些条件，从而增强对亚季节到季节预测的技能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection techniques enable the accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions in high-mountain regions for improved subseasonal-to-seasonal predictions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集技术能够准确初始化高山地区的地表温度和雪盖条件，以改善亚季节到季节的预测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions may be enabled by using observed T2m records, as mentioned in the LS4P Phase I project. The project utilized data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) and the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5) for initialization. The Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data was also used for detailed analysis over China.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 准确初始化地表温度和雪盖条件可以通过使用观测的2米气温（T2m）记录来实现，这在LS4P第一阶段项目中提到。该项目利用了国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS）和第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心（ECMWF）大气重分析（ERA5）数据进行初始化。同时，中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据也用于对中国地区的详细分析。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack in high-mountain regions not lead to the expected improvements in subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，地表温度和雪盖的初始化可能不会导致对季节内到季节性降水预测的预期改善，原因可能是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical yet remain scientifically challenging due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. Additionally, the ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference might be smaller than the observed anomaly, potentially causing underestimation of the effect.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置至关重要，但由于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷，这仍然是科学上具有挑战性的。此外，集合均值产生的T2m差异可能小于观测到的异常，这可能导致对影响的低估。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why do some Earth System Models fail to capture the observed atmospheric anomalies despite the initialization of land surface temperature anomalies over the Tibetan Plateau?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么一些地球系统模型在初始化青藏高原的陆地表面温度异常后，仍然无法捕捉到观察到的大气异常？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. There are large inter-model differences in the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere, which could contribute to the discrepancies.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 未能捕捉到TRC波列的参与者模型在参考观测和成功模型时大大低估了气候异常。模拟从青藏高原（TP）向南半球传播路径的模型之间存在较大差异，这可能导致了这些差异。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when using observed temperature data to identify relationships between Tibetan Plateau temperatures and global precipitation patterns?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在使用观测温度数据识别青藏高原温度与全球降水模式之间的关系时，可能会出现哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships, but challenges include the limited observational data and the potential for errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures, which can affect the ability to accurately model and predict precipitation patterns globally.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 观测到的T2m记录用于研究可能的关系，但挑战包括观测数据的有限性以及在生成观测到的TP表面温度时可能出现的错误，这可能影响准确建模和预测全球降水模式的能力。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective do you think the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack is in enhancing subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy in high-mountain regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您认为在高山地区初始化地表温度和雪盖对提高亚季节到季节预测准确性的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack is considered an innovative approach to improve prediction accuracy, as it addresses biases in models and enhances the representation of observed anomalies. This method allows Earth System Models to better simulate atmospheric conditions and predict precipitation, especially in 'hotspot' regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 土地表面温度和雪盖的初始化被认为是一种创新的方法，可以提高预测准确性，因为它解决了模型中的偏差，并增强了对观测异常的表现。这种方法使地球系统模型能够更好地模拟大气条件，并预测降水，特别是在“热点”地区。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when using ensemble models to predict global atmospheric responses to Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在使用集成模型预测青藏 Plateau 表面异常对全球大气响应时，可能会出现哪些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges include inter-model variability, which results in large differences in simulated propagation pathways and potentially inaccurate phase and amplitude of wave trains. Additionally, the models exhibit difficulty in capturing observed anomalies, leading to inconsistencies with observations and potential underestimation of the effects of surface anomalies.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 挑战包括模型间的变异性，这导致模拟传播路径存在较大差异，并可能导致波列的相位和幅度不准确。此外，这些模型在捕捉观测异常方面存在困难，导致与观测结果不一致，并可能低估表面异常的影响。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in collecting consistent observational data for land-atmosphere interactions in high mountain regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在高山地区收集一致的陆气相互作用观测数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges include limitations due to a lack of observational data and the tendency to focus on local feedbacks. Current Earth System Models (ESMs) struggle to preserve memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies because of deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data, which provide unbalanced initial atmospheric and land conditions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 挑战包括由于缺乏观测数据而导致的局限性，以及倾向于关注局部反馈。目前的地球系统模型（ESMs）在保持初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆方面存在困难，这主要是由于模型参数化和再分析数据的缺陷，这些缺陷导致初始的大气和陆地条件不平衡。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how datasets are sourced and utilized to study the impact of springtime temperature anomalies on global precipitation patterns.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白数据集是如何被获取和利用来研究春季温度异常对全球降水模式的影响的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets such as the Chinese Meteorological Administration T2m data and the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System T2m data are used to study these impacts. The data help identify locations where the initialization of land temperatures may enhance precipitation prediction skills. The Climate Research Unit data are also used for global precipitation analysis, ensuring comprehensive coverage of the regions of interest.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 中国气象局的T2m数据和气候异常监测系统的T2m数据等数据集用于研究这些影响。这些数据有助于识别地表温度初始化可能增强降水预测技能的位置。气候研究单位的数据也用于全球降水分析，确保对相关区域的全面覆盖。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze and summarize the various data collection methods utilized for capturing land surface and subsurface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas, such as the Tibetan Plateau, in the context of subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析和总结在高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）捕捉地表和地下温度异常的各种数据收集方法，特别是在季节到季节的预测背景下。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for capturing temperature anomalies include the use of observed T2m records from the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) and the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) for T2m data over the Tibetan Plateau and globally. The use of fifth-generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5) data is also mentioned for investigating atmospheric circulation and climatology. These methods involve collecting temperature data from ground stations and reanalysis datasets to provide a comprehensive understanding of temperature anomalies over high mountain areas.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 捕捉温度异常的数据收集方法包括使用中国气象局（CMA）的观测T2m记录和气候异常监测系统（CAMS）提供的T2m数据，涵盖青藏高原及全球范围。还提到使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心（ECMWF）大气重分析（ERA5）数据来研究大气环流和气候学。这些方法涉及从地面站和重分析数据集中收集温度数据，以提供对高山地区温度异常的全面理解。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please investigate potential datasets that could be used to evaluate precipitation anomalies and atmospheric circulation responses to land surface temperature effects in subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请调查潜在的数据集，这些数据集可以用于评估降水异常和大气环流对地表温度影响的响应，以便在亚季节到季节预测模型中进行评估。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include the Climate Research Unit (CRU) data for global precipitation and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) for observed temperature anomalies. Additionally, the ECMWF ERA5 atmospheric reanalysis data are used to study atmospheric circulation responses. These datasets provide critical information on temperature, precipitation, and atmospheric conditions, which are essential for evaluating the effects of land surface temperature anomalies on subseasonal-to-seasonal predictions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括全球降水的气候研究单位（CRU）数据和国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的观测温度异常数据。此外，欧洲中期天气预报中心（ECMWF）ERA5大气重分析数据用于研究大气环流的响应。这些数据集提供了关于温度、降水和大气条件的重要信息，这对于评估地表温度异常对季节内到季节预测的影响至关重要。
